actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to increase to 60 days the period before an election during which a Member of, or Member-elect to, the Congress may not make a mass mailing as franked mail if such Member or Member-elect is a candidate in such election.

summary.text: Extends the period during which a Member or Member-elect of Congress who is a candidate in a primary or general election is prohibited from sending mass mailings as franked mail to 60 days before such election.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to increase to 60 days the period before an election during which a Member of, or Member-elect to, the Congress may not make a mass mailing as franked mail if such Member or Member-elect is a candidate in such election.
